posts.title: 𝗡𝗼𝗻-𝘀𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝘁𝗶𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘂𝗹𝘁𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗻𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 Neten Dorji While nursing has been viewed as a profession best suited to students from science ba...
posts.description: 𝗡𝗼𝗻-𝘀𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝘁𝗶𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘂𝗹𝘁𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗻𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 Neten Dorji While nursing has been viewed as a profession best suited to students from science backgrounds, educators say that perception is outdated, and that students from arts and commerce streams are proving just as capable. The Apollo Bhutan Institute of Nursing and the Arura Nursing Institute have both begun admitting arts and commerce students to General Nursing and Midwifery (GNM) programmes, aligning with global practices. #nursing #education #healthcare #Bhutan
posts.content: 𝗡𝗼𝗻-𝘀𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝘁𝗶𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘂𝗹𝘁𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗻𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 Neten Dorji While nursing has been viewed as a profession best suited to students from science backgrounds, educators say that perception is outdated, and that students from arts and commerce streams are proving just as capable. The Apollo Bhutan Institute of Nursing and the Arura Nursing Institute have both begun admitting arts and commerce students to General Nursing and Midwifery (GNM) programmes, aligning with global practices.

posts.title: Editorial: 𝗔 𝗽𝗹𝗲𝗱𝗴𝗲 𝘄𝗲 𝗺𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲 Alcohol remains one of the biggest social problems in our co...
posts.description: Editorial: 𝗔 𝗽𝗹𝗲𝗱𝗴𝗲 𝘄𝗲 𝗺𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲 Alcohol remains one of the biggest social problems in our country. Solutions are rare, even though this substance has long been identified as a root cause of many evils including in the teachings of Lord Buddha. While we may not be able to eliminate alcohol completely, a small initiative could make a big difference: protecting our children from early exposure to it. https:  kuenselonline.com news a-pledge-we-must-all-make #alcohol #editorial #Bhutan
posts.content: Editorial: 𝗔 𝗽𝗹𝗲𝗱𝗴𝗲 𝘄𝗲 𝗺𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲 Alcohol remains one of the biggest social problems in our country. Solutions are rare, even though this substance has long been identified as a root cause of many evils including in the teachings of Lord Buddha. While we may not be able to eliminate alcohol completely, a small initiative could make a big difference: protecting our children from early exposure to it. https:  kuenselonline.com news a-pledge-we-must-all-make #alcohol #editorial #Bhutan

posts.title: 𝗚𝗿𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗵𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗹 𝗱𝗿𝗶𝘃𝗲: 𝗢𝗻𝗹𝘆 𝗳𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗵𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗹𝘀 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗰𝘂𝘁 Chencho Dema The country s ambitious bid to gree...
posts.description: 𝗚𝗿𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗵𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗹 𝗱𝗿𝗶𝘃𝗲: 𝗢𝗻𝗹𝘆 𝗳𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗵𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗹𝘀 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗰𝘂𝘁 Chencho Dema The country s ambitious bid to green its tourism industry has met its first real test: only five hotels all of them five-star properties have qualified under the country s newly launched Green Hotel Standard. The result underscores both the promise and the pressing challenges of aligning the hospitality sector with Bhutan s carbon-negative image. https:  kuenselonline.com ... green-hotel-drive-only-five... #hotel #Bhutan
posts.content: 𝗚𝗿𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗵𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗹 𝗱𝗿𝗶𝘃𝗲: 𝗢𝗻𝗹𝘆 𝗳𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗵𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗹𝘀 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗰𝘂𝘁 Chencho Dema The country s ambitious bid to green its tourism industry has met its first real test: only five hotels all of them five-star properties have qualified under the country s newly launched Green Hotel Standard. The result underscores both the promise and the pressing challenges of aligning the hospitality sector with Bhutan s carbon-negative image. https:  kuenselonline.com ... green-hotel-drive-only-five... #hotel #Bhutan

posts.title: Update of His Majesty s State Visit to Vietnam: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Air Servic...
posts.description: Update of His Majesty s State Visit to Vietnam: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Air Services Agreement was signed on August 19, 2025 between the Ministry of Infrastructure and Transport, Bhutan and the Civil Aviation Authority, Ministry of Construction, The Government of the Socialist Republic of Viet Nam in the presence of His Majesty The King and the President of Viet Nam. The objective of the MoU is to promote aeronautical relations in a spirit of cooperation and understanding for the benefit of both countries. #Update #energy #Aviation
posts.content: Update of His Majesty s State Visit to Vietnam: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Air Services Agreement was signed on August 19, 2025 between the Ministry of Infrastructure and Transport, Bhutan and the Civil Aviation Authority, Ministry of Construction, The Government of the Socialist Republic of Viet Nam in the presence of His Majesty The King and the President of Viet Nam. The objective of the MoU is to promote aeronautical relations in a spirit of cooperation and understanding for the benefit of both countries. #Update #energy #Aviation
